scenario_text.value:
Ironically, it all worked out like Aoi said,
even though she was out of her mind...

The two worlds, having been joined together
by the giant door, maintained an odd balance.

The world of the Kemonogami was saved, and no
more sacrifices were needed to sustain it.

The two worlds continued to exist as if they
had always been one.

But the Kemonogami, or rather, monsters,
started showing up in our world.
Humanity had no time to prepare.

The nature of the world simply changed, and
it happened to good and bad people alike.

Not everyone who gained the power of
a monster as a partner used that power well.

As a result, the world was thrown even
further into chaos.

And not everyone, be they human or monster,
found their partner.

In fact, most people never met a monster they
could call a partner at all.

This meant those who didn’t have a partner
feared those who did, which led to prejudice.

Most of the people who found partners were
captured, isolated, and held in captivity.

And the world was plunged into endless
destruction and chaos.
